Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Path to Glory
Description:
Warbands rise to power in every corner of the Mortal Realms. Mighty warriors and dread sorcerers marshal their forces as they set out to crush all who stand before them. This is Path to Glory, where legendary heroes and terrifying enemies are born in bloody battle.

In this book, you’ll learn how to place yourself in the blood-soaked boots of a powerful warlord, dragging an ever-growing band of fiercely loyal followers into savage combat across the Mortal Realms. Starting with a single champion and a few followers, you’ll – assuming your capacity for violence is enough – gradually turn your warband into a rapacious horde of killers edging ever closer to eternal glory.

Contained within:


     The Rise of Gulgaz – the story of the meteoric rise of Gulgaz Stoneklaw and his warclan, who expanded into a veritable juggernaut of an army;
     a detailed explanation of the Path to Glory campaign: how to create a warband, how Glory Points are accrued and spent (and the rewards they bring), and how to achieve eternal glory – the final victory in a campaign;
     a Warband Roster – this is a blank roster on which to document your warband and its exploits – you’re free to photocopy this;
     6 Battleplans – essentially, missions you can use in your campaign, each with a different objective that changes the way your games are played;
     Warband Tables – these are the rules used to determine the champion, followers and rewards for your warbands. Included are tables for the following factions: Khorne, Tzeentch, Nurgle, Slaanesh, Beasts of Chaos, Skaven, Clans Pestilens, Kharadron Overlords, Stormcast Eternals, Fyreslayers, Sylvaneth, Seraphon, Order (chosen from Human, Aelf and Duardin models), Ironjawz, Beastclaw Raiders, Bonesplitterz, Destruction (chosen from Orruk, Grot and Ogor models), Flesh-Eater Courts and Death;
     Start Collecting! Warbands – if you’re itching to get going, but don’t have the right models for a warband (or just fancy a new one…) then these are the rules for you – they’re designed to work with the Start Collecting! boxes of Warhammer Age of Sigmar models. Simply pick up a box, assemble the miniatures and you’re good to go – these rules have been fine-tuned to offer immediacy and balance.


—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly L.O.L. Surprise!
Description:
Monopoly, but there are fewer spaces: The board is only eight spaces per side, and each group only consists of two properties.
The theme is dolls and pets, and instead of upgrading with houses and hotels, you upgrade with stars and emojis.
Finally, Chance and Community Chest have been merged to one stack.

—user summary
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: White Castle Bold Move Challenge
Description:
The rules and game board are on the bottom of a Crave Case (a suitcase-like corrugated cardboard box used to package Sliders sold in lots of 30). Here are those rules:


     Pick a game piece; get creative.
     Use the Slider Box Challenges to play and make your moves.
     Accept the challenge yourself and move ahead, or give it to a friend. (If they don't take it, they go back a space.)
     Continue around the group, and the Craver who makes the boldest moves wins!


Share with #boldcraver for an extra move.

The Challenges published on the Slider boxes change over time, and the spaces moved vary depending upon the boldness required to complete the Challenge, ranging from 1 to 3.

Name: Flip-Flop Agents
Description:
An unidentified spy is approaching you. That would be one of the 8 spies who belong to one of the two factions.
In this game, you can see other players' cards but not your own. Under such situations, you have to report the number of FALSE’s spies and the spy approaching you.

—description from the designer

Name: The Battle of Trafalgar 1805
Description:
In the first of a potential new series Florian Richter presents colour profile models of every ship on both sides in this epic battle. In a change to previous paper soldier titles, these ships can be cut straight out of the book to create the British, French and Spanish fleets.

IGOUGO sequence, 
during each turn:

     Maneuvre phase
     Combat phase
     Boarding phase

Name: Coliseum
Description:
Simple one to one gladiator combat rules in Ancient Rome.

Turn sequence:

     Movement phase: each gladiator
     Combat phase: hand to hand fighting resolution with facing adjustements, fatigue


Use a 2D6 for combat resolution and initiative.

Game was published in Vae Victis Hors Serie N 1 Armées Miniatures, in French.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Christmas Village / Mexico
Description:
This is part of the 2019 expansions for Age of Steam. The Christmas Village is a solo map: you are the Christmas father and you must deliver all houses before the night is over.

Mexico is a 2p map; one player takes the role of the State and the other player takes the role of the Cartel.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Vietnam / Sahara
Description: This is part of the 2019 expansions for Age of Steam. In the Vietnam map (3-4p map) there are two scenarios and contains flooded hexes. In the Sahara (3-5p map) map you will need water to build in the desert hexes.

Name: Invictus: the Pharaoh
Description:
Invictus: the Pharaoh is a 2 player tactical card game. The player will be the Pharaoh and fight with opponent. While fighting with opponent’s army on the battlefield you must take care of your Kingdom because in this game, building better Kingdom than opponent’s, also let you win the game.

Destroying the enemy soldier might not always be the best move in this game. Capture them and make them your own to prosper your land.
There are multiple ways to use each card. You may use it as a soldier, as a citizen and as an assistance force. Use your cards wisely to win the battle.

2 player battle card game combined with unique mechanics such as Kingdom and Reserve, will lead you to the next battlefield.

—description from the designer

Name: Invictus: Odin
Description:
Invictus the Odin is a 2 player tactical card game. The player will be the Odin and fight with opponent. While fighting with opponent’s army on the battlefield you must take care of your Kingdom because in this game, building better Kingdom than opponent’s, also let you win the game.

Destroying the enemy soldier might not always be the best move in this game. Capture them and make them your own to prosper your land.
There are multiple ways to use each card. You may use it as a soldier, as a citizen and as an assistance force. Use your cards wisely to win the battle.

2 player battle card game combined with unique mechanics such as Kingdom and Reserve, will lead you to the next Battlefield.

—description from the designer

Name: Queen's Landing
Description:
Winner of the 2nd Roll & Write Competition

Every town has it’s secret societies, the shadow rulers, and Queen’s Landing is no exception.
You are the founder of one of those societies and your objective is to influence the Queen, the Bishop, and the Knight and to secure your secret position as the true ruler.
The game is played over multiple rounds and the player with the most Influence Points at the end is the winner.

Welcome to Queen’s Landing.

Overview: Queen's Landing is Roll & Write with area control and resource gathering.

—description from the designer

Name: Mi Saquito de Huesos
Description:
Bold traveler! Colect tiles of bones on your desert board. Complete your character and, sing!. Nothing can stop your song.

My little pouch of bones is a boardgame proyect for children. A familiar game which also you can usein the classroom. It’s created specificaly to chids with the intention that they learn the body scheme singing.

If you already know us, you know that or games have a musical component that it´s not simply a soundtrack or a setting. And if you just find us, you know that we’ re going to make mischief with music.

In this case, we have created a song to remember some body parts.
In some moments, even, we name some parts of the human skeleton or bones.
We hope you like.

COMPONENTS
The game has:

     1 pouch
     4 boards of skeleton-character, reversible
     44 wilcards of skeleton-character.
     20 tokens breath-live
     12 wildcards of the desert


We tell you!!
Know or peculiar family, an arab father, a native mather, an European adopted child and an asian cousin who was orphaned.

SETUP

      Chouse a character which you’ll play.
      Take the board with your character.
      Every player do the same.
      Set aside the rest of boards.
      Put the tiles of the chosen character in the pouch of bones.
      Place the breath-life tokens on the table. It varies according to the number of players.
      The first player will be who’s the last one who make a trip.


GAME SECUENCE

     At firts of your turn take two tiles from the pouch.



     Check if one of them has a piece of your character.



     If it does, you can place it on your skeleton by the side that fit with the bones. If bouth tiles are from your character you can place them on your skeleton. In case that one of them is from other character you can place it on his skeleton if you have place on yours first, always by the bones side. In case that you took two tiles of other characters ends your turn and discart the tiles on your little pouch with skeleton side up.



     When you place a tile on the skeleton of other player put a breath-life token of your character color over the tile. In case that you take a tile of desert you can remove tokens of other players that are over your skeleton.



     Any player with a tile of desert can can take a tile of the little pouch of other players. If it’s of his character, he place it on his board for the bones side, if it’s of other player character he can place on the board of that character an a breath-life token of his color.


The game ends when the pouch get empty

SCORE

     Every tile place on your character for you score 2 points.
     Every tile place on the skeleton of other player score 1 point.
     Wins who has more points.


GAME MODE: sing to your skeleton

      After score, remove the breath-life tokens and take every tiles that you have on your skeleton
      Flip the board and play with your character side.
      Prepare the song “My little pouch of bouns” in your tablet, smartphone or computer.
      Who place the tiles for the side of his character on the board faster while the song is playing won 3 poins.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Go Nuts for Donuts: Diet Free Deck
Description:
Go Nuts for Donuts: Free Free Diet is a deck of 25 other cards that introduces 10 extra sweets. The new inviting cakes, like apple fritters or donuts, can be added to the basic game for an even more delicious game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Beauharnais
Description:
This is a trick-taking game.There is a card game called “Napoleon” in Japan.
“Beauharnais” is a remake of Napoleon.

"Beauharnais" is Napoleon's wife.

Beauharnais got tired of the world. So she is looking for stimulation.

There is one young man in love with Beauharnais.
Beauharnais invites aristocratic daughters to hold a product review to confirm the love of young people.

Beauharnais secretly tells the youth to tell him what he wants and put it on the fair.

Can youth convey love?

—description from the publisher

Name: Ultima Ratio Regum
Description:
Ultima Ratio Regum - Le dernier argument des rois, the last argument of kings, was the devise inscribed on Louis XIV guns.

The rules simulate warfare during the Lace Wars (la Guerre en Dentelle) - late XVII - XVIII centuries, using miniatures.

1 mini = 40-60 men
1 gun = 2-4 guns and crew
1 turn = 2-3 min real time
Base: varies depending on minis scale, compatible with other rules. 
Miniatures can be used from 6 to 28 mm.

1- Setup - before the battle starts
Then each turn alternating:
2- Start of turn
2.A - Orders phase
2.B - Rally phase
2.C - Initiative
2.D - Activation and orders resolution for side A. B can do opportunity reactions.
2.D.I - Charges declarations
2.D.II - Charges moves
2.D.III - Regular moves
2.D.IV - Fire
2.D.V - Mêlées
2.E - Activation and orders resolution for side B. A can do opportunity reactions. repeat sequence D.I to D.V
2.F - End of turn - all orders completed
2.G - End of turn and start of next turn (2.A)

Rules were published in Vae Victis Hors Serie N°15, in French only.
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: TTMC: Le Complément Belge
Description:
Discover this addon written by Belgian authors, with solely Belgian subjects.

It is highly advised to play this extension with the TTMC basegame.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Découvrez cette extension faite par des auteurs belges, avec uniquement des sujets belges.
 Pour passer un bon moment, il est vivement conseillé de jouer avec la boîte TTMC de base.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vortex
Description:
A deep space mission to study an imploding star has met disaster and now the science team and ship's crew face the threat of a forming blackhole. 1 - 6 players can choose to play as either a competitive scientists trying to claim the new discoveries for yourself or as cooperative crew members struggling to survive together. Or you can try to survive alone in solitaire play. Begin your journey trapped in the gravity pull of the vortex. Once free you must reach the rescue ship before becoming permanently trapped in vortex. Game features randomly assigned characters, each with a unique ability, and a dwindling oxygen supply for an added level of difficulty. Players decide the overall difficulty level of the game; from Novice to Madness.

—description from the designer

Name: Jungle Speed: Mini-extension inédite
Description:
Additional 40-cards expansion for Jungle Speed that was sold along the game in 2009.

It features:

     A new set of symbols.
     A fifth colour and extra cards in that colour.
     A new sort of special card.

Name: Word Limit
Description:
Word Limit is a fast, competitive clue-giving word game with multiple dynamics.

A card with six words is visible for everyone to see. Two opposing players are the clue-givers. They compete to give a clue that indicates one word to the other players, while not being confused with the other five words. But wait! A Word Limit card is first drawn, restricting what the clue-givers are even allowed to say in the first place. But don't wait! Whoever gives their clue first claims the chance to earn the point!

—description from the designer
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Aunt Agatha's Attic
Description:
Family is the most important treasure of all — for now!

You and your cousins may not like each other very much, but you all love your Aunt Agatha — and her vast collection of treasures from around the world! In the fast and frenzied card game Aunt Agatha's Attic, you must race against the clock to bargain with your cousins for the best of Agatha's collection, simultaneously trading glowing emeralds, bone-handled daggers, and even selfless hugs before time runs out. Can you work together to show your aunt just how important family is, all while keeping the best stuff for yourself?

—description from the publisher

Name: Indépendance !
Description:
Simple rule set to simulate the battles of the American War of Independence 1776-1781.

Sequence of play:
Alternative

     Moral tests resolution
     Movements inc. charges and counter-charges
     Fires are declared, then resolved
     Mêlées 


Scale:
- Brigade level
- 1 mini ~ 20 men
- 1cm = 10m

Rules published in Vae Victis Hors Serie N°1 "Armées Miniatures", in French

Name: Im Fluge um die Erde
Description:
Game 1 (Middle Europe)
Each player gest a flight plan card and has to get his plane from indivated starting point to destination point. Movement is determined with two dice.  Between some cities a unlucky number is indicated in the game board. If a player rolls this number with one of his dice while passing this point, he has to undertake an emergency landing and is eliminated from the game.
The first player to arrive at his destination wins the game.

Game 2 (World)
Each player hast to follow 1 of 6 flight plans, determined by the roll of a die. Movement is determined by two dice. If one die shows the number of ones flight plan, the plane is moved according to the second die. If a plane gets on a black dot, it iss lost and the player is eliminated from the game. The first player to arrive at his destination wins the game.

—user summary

Name: "Stern mit Biene"-Spiel
Description:
The players start on space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder of benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Królestwo
Description:
In the game you are a king or queen on the road to the Kingdom of Heaven. You need to collect the 5 pieces of the Armor of Faith and shed your sins to enter the Castle.

Using roll & move, each player makes his way through the outer kingdom, where they can either purchase pieces of Armor by paying collected Light or gain them in random encounters (card draws). Equipped with the five pieces of armor (that bestow special abilities) they can cross to the inner kingdom, where they must shed themselves through sin or gain the power of Love, through a new series of adventures with morale choices.

The game is meant to teach Christian values to primary school children.

Name: Obscurio: Promo Trap Tokens
Description:
Three new Trap tokens distributed by the publisher at various conventions. It was also included in the Asmoplay Mystery Box (September 2019).

Rules:

     Music Hall (Affects Step 2 and 4): The Wizards can only communicate by singing. The Grimoire is not affected by this token.
     Raving Mad (Affects Step 2): Take the Loyality card from each Wizard (without revealing them) and mix them facedown. Then, deal on to each Wizard. This token is then put back in the box (its effect can not occur more than once per game.)
     Aphonia (Affects Step 2 and 4): The Wizards can only communicate through gesturesand mimes. They may not talk, sing, or make any verbal noise of any kind. The Grimoire is not affected by this token.If this token is drawn in the last Room (the Guardroom),it has no effect.

Name: Trade Secret
Description:
This is a strategy game about strategy. Trade Secret will challenge your foresight, decision-making, and competitive spirit. It is designed for the seasoned game-lover, continuously learning leader, and business student alike. There is more than one way to learn something by playing this game. All of the strategies in this game are real and promote best practices in Organization Development. Read each strategy description as you introduce new strategies to the game.

Imagine you are the CEO of your new start-up, a strategy guru, ready create the direction for your organization. Your industry is complex and changing. Just last year, the biggest player in the industry unexpectedly collapsed. The first order of business is to gain awareness about your Management, Environment, Communications, Innovation, and Culture. These are five of the most important influences on strategy.

The game itself mirrors a common strategic planning exercise in the business world: the SWOT Analysis. SWOT stands for Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats and the exercise is designed to increase your awareness of your internal and external environment. A good SWOT Analysis then takes the following critical step. You must take that newfound awareness and implement useful strategies for your organization.

But beware, no competitive advantage lasts forever—Except the ability to adapt. Welcome to the world of business psychology and strategic planning.

May the best strategies win!

—description from the designer

Name: Rebisworld
Description:
Make and live stories with Rebisworld teaches you how to acquire the skills and behaviours you need to face life.
Learning to guide yourself and others through the solution of internal conflicts, action plans and effective strategies.
Rebisworld is aimed at all those who want to grow and improve their learning of happiness.
Entering the world of 12 souls is a true gym for actions, emotions and sensations.

TARGET
Bring together 2 to 6 participants, not just to tell and write a story together, but to experience it firsthand.

We don't simply put ourselves in the shoes of the main character, but we become one with him through his senses.

MISSION
At the same time, we are the creators and protagonists of the story of one of the 12 souls in the world of Rebisworld, which develops in 4 parts:
The principle
The turning point
The conclusion
The epilogue

At the end of each of these phases there is a vote in which we elect one of the writings. The chosen text becomes part of the story and becomes the starting point for the creation of the following ones.

In Rebisworld the whole process takes about 60 minutes. For each of the 4 parts the estimated time is about 10 minutes for the realization of the three writings and 5 minutes for the vote.

At the end the winner is the one who gets the most number of elected parts of history.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sorcerer: Egyptian Battlefield Set
Description:
These battlefields features an Egyptian theme and new battlefield effects. They can be used in standard games, or to allow Battle Royale with more than 4 players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cookie Crumble
Description:
Fast grabbin' cookie making fun!

Be the first to make your cookies in this silly game of cookie makin' fun.  Grab the ingredients you need to make your cookies.  Collect sugar, flour, butter, eggs, and your cookie flavoring to win the game.  But watch out for the rotten egg - he ruins the whole batch of cookies and you have to start again!

—description from the publisher

Each player receives one of eight recipe card which details their personal goal for the game.  A recipe card has the name of the recipe (e.g. Oatmeal Raisin Cookies) and five ingredients the player will be searching for (e.g. sugar, flour, oatmeal & raisins, butter, and eggs).  The deck of 36 ingredient cards is shuffled and placed face-down in the middle of the play area, where it's scattered to make all cards accessible.

Play is simple and chaotic.  Players grab at cards, one at a time, from the center and look at them.  If they need the card, they keep it.  If they don't, they put it back.

Among the cards are four "rotten egg" cards.  If a player draws a rotten egg, play temporarily stops while the player who drew it mixes all their collected ingredients back into the center.  Once done, play resumes as normal.

This continues until one player has collected all five ingredients.

—user summary

Name: Wise Up!
Description:
The game is provided as an 11" x 17" magazine centerfold.  All instructions and the playing board are provided on the centerfold; a required six-sided die is not included.  Players form two opposing teams with at least two players per team recommended.  The two teams assume the function of the Biblical wise men, traveling from their home to Bethlehem and gathering gifts along the way.

Play alternates between the teams, with each rolling and moving the rolled number of squares.  Squares have game instructions for completion.  Many squares incorporate 6 separate actions, one of which is randomly selected by die roll.  Most game instructions direct some type of trivia exercise, based in Biblical or Christian knowledge of the birth of Jesus Christ and, especially, the visiting wise men.  Successful completion of the trivia activity yields a gift for the team.

The first team to acquire all the needed gifts and then complete the journey to Bethlehem wins the game.

The game is published in the New Era magazine, a publication of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, primarily directed at youth ages 12 to about 18.  Print and PDF copies are available.

—user summary

Name: Play the Patriarchy
Description:
Play the Patriarchy is a fast-paced card-matching game aimed at taking down (or at least taking a good jab at) the patriarchy.

Players each draw nine cards; the Matriarch (the dealer) pulls a prompt card. Players can use any combination of their cards to create a response to the prompt; Subject, Verb, and Descriptor cards allow for infinite possibilities of riotous phrases. The Matriarch chooses the best (or funniest) answer, and the winner becomes the Matriarch for the next round. The game is over when all the cards have been played.

—description from the publisher

Name: Squillo City
Description:
SQUILLO CITY (CALL GIRL CITY)
ITALY’S BEST SELLING SATYRICAL CARD GAME IS BACK WITH EVEN MORE CRUELTY AND EVEN LESS POLITICAL CORRECTNESS!

The game is set in the city of Milangeles where sex and cultural stereotypes serve as a backdrop for an all-out war amongst the city’s prostitute factions - Russians, Asians, Africans, Americans and Latinas. Pick your favorite and battle it out across town as you engage in shady business, sell yourself on the streets, or off your competitors.

How to play:
Each player’s turn is very quick and composed of two main phases: 
Movement (Mandatory) and Action (Optional)
Movement Phase: 
You must move your character to any new location along the line you’re currently on. The new location may not be occupied by another player.  
Action:
You may take a single action chosen from those on the new location you’re occupying. Alternatively, you may use any action ability present on one of your call girls’ cards as long as its symbol matches the one on the currently occupied location. 
The effects of each action are found on the game board or on the call girl cards. 
After you have taken your action, and if you do not wish to play cards from your hand, you may end your turn and the player on your left will be the next active player.

During your turn you may play as many cards as you like from your hand, as long as their symbols match those on the currently occupied location.

Winning the Game:
The game ends immediately when the last card from the Black Market is purchased or when the last Coin is drawn from the Coin Pool. The player with the most Coins is declared the winner. In case of a draw, the player with the most Call Girls wins - should this also result in a draw, the victory is shared amongst the winning players.

Name: Toy story 4
Description:
In Toy Story 4 you take turns picking cards from a common storage and immediately place them in front of you. The way the storage works is central to the game and where the real interaction takes place.

The cards show shelves with toys. The background behind the shelves is either green, yellow or blue. When you place the cards in front of you, i e build the shelves, you may have a shelf of each of the 3 colors.

Some toys get an extra bonus for being placed next to each other, other toys cannot be placed next to each other.
Usually you may only have one toy of each sort on a shelf so you will have to finish shelves during the game. When you finish a shelf you put it to your scoring pile and may start a new shelf of that color.

When the game ends you add up all points shown on the cards you in your scoring pile. Most Points win.

Name: Color Addict: Édition 10e anniversaire
Description:
Discover the anniversary edition of the classic Color Addict game!

Even more color cards, red glasses to annoy your opponents ...

Get rid of your cards as quickly as possible by superimposing the words, the colors, the two or the opposite ...

Not to mention the beautiful red glasses, which will change your vision of life (and cards), but especially make you look a bit ridiculous (to distract your opponents ...)!

If you already own the classic version of Color Addict, you can combine the games to play even longer and / or with even more players!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Découvrez l'édition anniversaire du classique Color Addict !

Encore plus de cartes couleurs, des lunettes rouges pour embêter vos adversaires…

Débarrassez-vous de vos cartes le plus vite possible en superposant les mots, les couleurs, les deux ou l’inverse…

Sans oublier les superbes lunettes rouges, qui vont changer votre vision de la vie (et des cartes), mais surtout vous donner un air un peu ridicule (pour déconcentrer vos adversaires...)!

Si vous possédez déjà la version classique de Color Addict, vous pouvez combiner les jeux pour jouer encore plus longtemps et/ou avec encore plus de joueurs!

—description from the publisher

Name: Distrito 6
Description:
In Distrito 6, each player represents a construction company building the 6th District of Dadópolis, following the district planning, earning points during the game; fulfilling secret goals, which are revealed and scored at the end of the game; and having majority on each floor, earning points at the end of the game.

The game lasts four rounds, divided into four phases each: rolling, players roll all their free dice; allocation, players gain benefits from place their dice into spots on the board; construction, players earn point by constructing dice into the district; and cleaning, players prepare for the next round.

—description from the publisher

Name: B-25 Prince of the Skies
Description: Based on the popular B-17 Queen of the Skies game, this has the same rule set, just modified to for the B-25 and different campaign settings.

Name: AlphaBet Board Game
Description:
AlphaBet is a fun and competitive word creation game. Conceptualised by a copywriter, a designer and an innovator in London - we are the Alpha Pack.

How to play?
Choose your challenge by picking a game Settings Card. This will decide how many words of how many letters you need to create.

Roll the dice and move around the board to collect letters from the library.

When landing on a green letter collect an Alpha card, and a Bet card when landing on a red letter. Each card comes with exciting challenges like:
Rolling the dice in win-or-lose competitions 
Swapping, winning or losing letters 
Exchanging letters with the library and the archive.

Win the game by completing the set word challenge and shout ‘AlphaBet!’.

An AlphaBet game lasts on average 30 minutes and it can be played by 2 to 8 players.

If you enjoy Monopoly and Scrabble, we think this game will be perfect for you.

—description from the designer

Name: Kinderlieder-Memo
Description:
This game comes with 72 memory cards and a CD and you. An Play it in two main game modes:


     Normal memo-game
     Using the CD you can play a reaction game. Play the CD in shuffle-mode. Then grab the associated tile of the song as fast as possible.


On top of that the rulebook holds all texts from the 36 children songs to sing them along the instrumentals on the CD.

—user summary

Diese Kinderlieder-Memo ist ein spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Gedächtnisspiel für die ganze Familie.

Wer findet die meisten Paare? Und wer errät die Kinderlieder, die auf den Memo-Karten dargestellt sind?

Im Begleitheft sind Texte aller 36 Kinderlieder aufgeführt - zum Mitsingen zur beiliegenden CD.

—description from the publisher

Name: Codenames: Bonus Pack – Literatur
Description: 10 bonuscards for Codenames with a literature theme.

Name: Override
Description:
Override is an abstract game for two players. The goal is simple: get five in a row in your color. What makes it interesting is that you and your opponent each have the option of controlling each other's pieces rather than your own on any given turn.

All 30 pyramids begin off the 5×5 board. Each turn, a player may bring a piece onto an empty square on the board or move a piece that is already on the board one space orthogonally. Larger pieces can cover up smaller pieces of either color; same-size stacking and smaller-on-larger stacking is not permitted. Pieces covering up other pieces are fair game to move orthogonally just like solo pieces. Players may make these moves with either their own color or the opposing color. A group of two or three pieces on the same square count as the top color for purposes of the five-in-a-row goal. It is possible for a pyramid to be temporarily blocked in due to its being surrounded on four sides by larger pyramids. Players are not allowed to directly undo an opponent's last move, but they are allowed to create a very similar board-state. For instance, if there are four yellow pyramids in a row and the active player moves a medium yellow pyramid out of line, the next player is not allowed to move the medium yellow pyramid back into place, but is allowed to bring an identical medium yellow pyramid from off the board into that square.

The first player to create a line of five in a row, diagonally or orthogonally, wins the game. In the case of two lines of opposing colors simultaneously being created, the active player wins.

Requires a 5×5 grid and 30 pyramids: fifteen each in two colors.

—description from the designer

Name: Penguin Creche
Description:
This is a game where you can exchange penguin chicks and find out what is the biggest creche.
Each player has three moves.
In those three exchanges, you need to memorize the numbers that have been moved, guess the numbers that are not visible, and do all the handmade things you need to win at the same time.

It is a game that is chewy even in the lightness of a small component packed with several game elements.

Name: The Journey of My Future Self
Description:
"From the future me to the past me
Tomorrow, I am going on a journey.
It's a mysterious letter from the future."

The Journey of My Future Self, a.k.a., æ˜Žæ—¥ã€æ—…ã«å‡ºã¾ã™, is a solitaire game in which you are invited to go on a journey and follow the mysteries of a closed world. As you travel, you encounter incidents from the past, present, and future, all of which will be repeated over and over again. You have to know them all in order to solve them. Will you be able to solve the mysteries of this world?

In more detail, The Journey of My Future Self is a game of medium to short-term planning in which you have to constantly think about the best way to move your pawns, taking into account the numbers 1 to 6 that are randomly given and the numbers that are yet to be seen.

The small number of cards used in the game (30) makes it difficult to recover from mistakes, and a single mistake can make the game impossible to complete. For this reason, we encourage thought experiments (trial play). This is all part of the solitaire nature of the game, which is designed to be played slowly and deliberately, without disturbing other players, no matter how long you think. We want you to forget everything else and immerse yourself in the game!

You can manipulate the difficulty of the game to some extent by using any combination of "items" that change the basic rules. If you want to enjoy the atmosphere of the game, you can use more items to reduce the difficulty. If you are aiming for a solid high score, you can choose to barter the risks and benefits. This freedom of use makes the game replayable and flexible, allowing the player to adjust the difficulty according to their preferences.

—description from the publisher

Name: Heroic Saga
Description:
This is a fantasy RPG quiz game where prior experience can be used to achieve victory.

The bard (the player who questions) will get points if the audience (the responding player) is correct. However zero points if everyone is correct. In addition, if everyone is wrong, you will be penalized with a negative point.

Name: Trade Tycoon
Description:
This is a card game limited to 3 players with the theme of Silk Road Trade.
Players collect goods by exchanging their hands with each other based on a small amount of information disclosed.
It is necessary to decide your own “style” in the middle of the game, and the products collected according to the calculation formula according to the style will be scored.
Once the style has been decided, it cannot be changed, so the key is how far the product can be collected while keeping the information confidential.

Each game ends with 10 moves, and it is a game with a variety of strategies in the ease.

—description from the publisher (translated)

A card game inspired by a detective drama of the Showa era.

The player becomes one of the "five unique detectives" and investigates the case by allocating 24 hours each. Five cases are set at the same time, and a five-row, plot-type auction is held. Scores will be given to the 1st and 2nd place "in the time allotted" for each case. Do this for 3 hands.

Detectives work together to investigate the case, but often go to stand, play to seek credit, or settle with the culprit. As a result, you may get deeply involved in the incident and get seriously injured or you may be killed!ã€€Moreover, even if you get a line of duty, the game is not over, and if you can get a line of duty at a good show, you can earn a high score. Produce your own line of duty scene well and decide "What's this !!!!"

The basis of the game is a "5-row, plot-type auction".ã€€A total of 24 common cards will be given to the player as a hand, and one card will be placed in each of the five cases, for a total of five cards. After placing, reveal the cards, and after seeing the result, arrange the remaining 5 sheets in the same way and judge by the total value. Therefore, it is important to avoid competition as much as possible and get more cases efficiently, because it is possible to guess to some extent who wants which case with the first placement.

Then, shouldn't it be better to hide the information by arranging as few numbers as possible for the first placement? Of course, that's one strategy. However, if the numbers are the same, there is a rule that the one with the larger number placed on the first sheet wins, so it is not always advantageous to arrange the smaller numbers.ã€€In addition, each person has a ticket called hero time, and you can win regardless of the number unless the heroes spend time fighting with each other. Where to use this hero time is also important.

Name: Quo Vadis
Description:
The light of the beginning!
The gods who created the world next wanted faithful servants who worshiped themselves.
The gods breathed life into the soil that they created to resemble themselves, and five races were born in this world.

This is a war game depicting the rise and conflict of various races.
This is a strategic-level game that competes in how to invade territory, eliminate foreign enemies, and spread and maintain your own prints. Because of the narrowness of the map, pacifism does not work. Somewhere in the game, you will almost certainly get into war.

Name: In Vino Morte: Caseus Vitae
Description:
A three card expansion for Chris Anderson’s In Vino Morte.


From the publisher gameplay summary:

When dealing out cards, you may also give out cheese cards to whoever you choose.

Each player gets a face down glass as normal, and some players may also get a cheese card.

On a player’s turn they can drink or swap glasses as normal, or choose to steal cheese from another player.

Players cannot give cheese away or have more than one cheese at a time.

When you drink, if you have cheese, the results of your drink are reversed: Wine will kill you and poison will not.

Name: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Card Game
Description:
Trick-taking game for two teams of two players. Points are scored for cards in tricks that are won by the team. Tricks are won by having the highest "Labyrinthe" in a trick or the highest card in the minor suit that was led, if no Labyrinthes are played. A hand consists of 19 tricks. The team with the most points in a hand wins the hand. The team with the most hands won after 4 hands are played wins the game. If the game is tied after 4 hands are played, then one more hand is played, with the winner of that hand winning the game.

Rules for 2, 3, and 5 players are available at the publisher's web site.

—user summary

A game for the whole family. based on medieval card games and set in the magical world of Jim Henson's Labyrinth.

The deck of the Labyrinth Card Game includes 80 beautifully illustrated tarot-sized cards, divided into 24 Major Suit cards ('Labyrinthes') and 4 x 14 Minor Suit cards ('Owls', 'Clocks', 'Orbs", and 'Books').

The simple core rules allow 4 players to have a quick, fun game, suitable for all the family. The advanced rules turn the game into a more sophisticated, highly tactical experience, more suitable for grown-ups. The game is designed for 4 players.

—description from the back of the box
Families: Series: Jim Henson's Board Game Collection (River Horse)

Name: Victory
Description:
This wartime jump and move game has the objective of players to move men across an open field past enemy guards and into an opposing fort.

5 Guards sit along a row in front of their fort. Opposition players can move and jump over the man in front (like checkers) to proceed towards the opposing fort but must follow a line connecting the next space.

When the enemy men enter the lines of the fortification the guards attempt to eliminate and remove them by jumping over them.

Whoever gets the highest number of men into the enemy's fort wins the game.

The national Archives of Australia cites registration of a design by Evan Joseph Roy Simpson for Parlour game entitled The Victory V Game in 1941

—user summary

Name: Swing and Snap
Description:
Each player puts monkey cards in rows of the same colour. The player who places the fourth monkey collects all the monkey cards in that row. But watch out, a crocodile may snap them all up first, or a monkey may stop to eat a banana. Continue until no more cards can be drawn from the deck. The player with the most monkey cards is the winner.

—user summary

Name: ゴリラ人狼 (Gorilla Werewolf)
Description:
In ã‚´ãƒªãƒ©äººç‹¼ (Gorilla Werewolf, which is pronounced "Gorilla Jinrou"), you take on the role of gorillas with poachers in their midst. Gameplay is much like normal Werewolf — except you can speak only in grunts. Luckily when gorillas die, they gain the ability to speak human words briefly, and dying gorillas can choose any two words to teach the remaining players.

Can you overcome the limitations of your vocabulary to find the traitor in your midst?

Name: Bones & Banners
Description:
Bones & Banners is a fantasy field battle game played with dice and cards. Each player commands their own army deck of unit cards that are used to defend allied lands and conquer enemy lands to be victorious. Players can also hire advisors and construct practical buildings to better their odds in winning the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Renegade Legion: Reinforcements
Description:
Includes new ships stats! Updates on the TOG, the Commonwealth, and the KessRith Empire!
Over 50 4-color Ships & Tanks!

Adds 2 scenarios and 12 Ship variants for INTERCEPTOR
Adds 2 scenarios and 10 Grav Tanks variants for CENTURION
Adds 2 scenarios and 7 Ship variants for LEVIATHAN

—description from the publisher

Name: Stargazer
Description:
The world of stars that once looked up from the ground.
With the rapid development of space technology, the human race that finally enabled interstellar navigation
At last, we will start exploring unknown planets.

Waiting there is a brilliant glory or an unexpected ruin.
The greatest romance of mankind opens!

Name: The Mennonite Game Card Game
Description:
Find your connections to various characters with this family friendly strategy game! Whether you are Mennonite or not, you will find this game fun and entertaining!

" The Mennonites play a game predictably called "The Mennonite Game," in which people try and discover how they might be connected. For example, I might find out that you were my brother's roommate's sister's ex-boyfriend's high school teacher. The game that I have created is a card game inspired by the Mennonite game, thus the title "The Mennonite Game Card Game."" - Description by the designer

Each person begins with a Starter Card, which is you! The object of the game is to be the first to collect 10 Character Cards.

The Character Cards you acquire branch off of the Starter Card to form your character tree. The trick of the game is collect characters that benefit you, while also fitting into your character tree.

You gain characters by turning in Connection Cards. There are 4 different types, and a wild card that can be used for any one connection type.

The third type of card is the Event Card. These cards can be played at any time during your turn to draw cards, block someone's Character tree, remove effects, and much more!

Name: Paper Company
Description:
Run your very own paper company branch, while navigating the shifting economy, hiring employees, and maintaining your branch's morale.

In Paper Company, the economy is determined for all players based on a single die roll each round. The higher the roll is, the better the economy and the stronger each players' actions will perform that round. Once the economy is determined, all players choose 1 of 5 actions based on the roll:

     Accounting: To gain money
     Purchasing: To buy paper
     Sales: To sell paper
     Human Resources: To increase morale
     Recruiting: To hire or fire employees


By acquiring employees you can increase the benefits for specific actions, gain benefits when other players perform matching actions, and obtain abilities unique to that employee. However, be cautious who you hire, as employees have minds of their own always triggering their abilities, whether you want them to or not.  You must also be wary of how you treat your employees, as each branch has unique benefits, or detriments, based on how your employees feel about your management style.

With 5 unique branches and 40 unique employees, every game plays out differently. How will you manage your unique branch? Will you focus on one action, allowing other players to take advantage of your repetition? Will you get and keep morale high to reap the benefits of happy, productive employees, or try to make money quickly and work around the consequences? Will you focus on recruiting and fill your office with as many employees as you can, or will you try to avoid employees altogether and run the office by yourself?

—description from the designer

Name: Battle Toons: The House Of Jive
Description:
In the city of Kokomo, the ruffian know as “The Jazz Man” has opened up a shady casino called The House Of Jive. The residential toons of Kokomo aren’t too happy about this and try to get the casino shut down. They however do not succeed as The Jazz Man is protected with the magic of “The Great Kokkino” and the might and insanity of “Jack De Lune”. Our heroes “Vega O’ Dar”, “Darla Dwolf”, and “Coyote Pete” have been alerted by The Jazz Man’s actions and are teaming up with YOU to stop him and get his casino shut down! With the magic of The Great Kokkino, he is holding all of these other toon’s against their will and are being forced to fight and protect the casino. Will you defeat The Jazz Man? Or will you succumb to his game?

—description from the designer

Name: Iwari: The Storm
Description: Two storm metal coins with rules to use them as a small expansion bound to the territory connection and the vulnerability of climate change.

Name: Trial by Trolley: Kickstarter Expansion
Description:
This is a 100 card expansion with 10 themes voted on by the Kickstarter backers. It contains 10 cards from the following categories:

     Sci-fi
     Post-Apocalyptic
     Majestic Creatures
     Gods
     Planet Earth
     The '90's
     Cryptids
     Tom
     Backer-Submitted Cards
     Trolley Tom Story Cards

Name: Trial by Trolley: Derailed Bonus Pack
Description: A 25-card bonus back for Trial by Trolley

Name: Joking Hazard: Trial by Trolley Exclusives
Description: This pack of 20 cards was included as Kickstarter-exclusive promo content for the Trial by Trolley Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Mum-Mum Margaret: Bronze Leaf
Description: Mum-Mum Margaret: Bronze Leaf is a two-player game that is semi-handmade by a team of artisans. Each player takes turns to draw colorful petals and place them onto a spot with the same symbol. If you follow a certain order to put petals, you can place multiple of them in one turn for more points. Billy the honey bee will fly around each turn from a flower to another. Placing a petal onto the spot where he is stopped will activate special effect(s) depending on the definition of the flower he is stopping. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Zen Solo
Description:
ZENã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ« ã‚½ãƒ­ (ZEN Tiles Solo) is a solitaire board game that challenges you to look at yourself objectively while placing emotion tiles on a 24-hour timeline.

To win, you need to find a spot to place twenty different emotion tiles above these time boards, so think carefully about "your yesterday". You might have become happy about yourself — "I had a positive thoughts!" — or were perhaps surprised: "I didn't realize that I have negative feelings every time when I see this person."

"Knowing yourself" is one of the most important processes to find a way to make our life better, and it is ZEN. Giving five minutes each day to yourself to play this game alone in a quiet place and listen to your soul could be good meditation for the people who feel tired every day.

ZEN Tile Solo is a game through which you can learn your hidden emotions and organize them to make your life calmer and better.
publisher's summary

ZENã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ« ã‚½ãƒ­ (Zen Tiles Solo) published in 2019, has wooden components in a small, silver foil stamped box. It is a one player game. There are 20 Emotion Tiles, a time track and 1 Elegant Stone. The rules are in English and Japanese, with both languages shown on the Emotion Tiles. ZenTiles are from Fukui Prefecture, where the Eiheiji Temple, also known as the birthplace of Zen, is located.
user summary

Name: Master of Wills: Edgehunter Expansion Faction Deck
Description:
Edgehunter brings new elemental powers to the game. Cast out from society they are forced to wander the wastelands looking to survive. When all hope seems lost, they stumble upon a lost artifact that imbues the survivors with elemental powers long forgotten. These new magical abilities cause these outcasts to ban together forming the faction of Edgehunter. With these new powers they will fight for their rightful place.

The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Combining these technologies with their elemental powers, Edgehunters cans trike and take back their place in the world.

—description from the publisher

Name: Punctuation Pirates and Their Grammar Galleons
Description:
Punctuation Pirates and Their Grammar Galleons is the first game created by Robert Zumbrun and James R. Orr, a games created by teachers for students, to use in the classroom. This game has been a longtime passion for both these teachers, first proto-typed in 2011 and used in the classroom since It has been extensively played by students and teachers alike, and so much fun and joy has come from gameplay. This print-and-play version is for used for all teachers, students, or any who enjoy a good game of piratey fun.

A game of piracy, adventure on the high seas, and historical facts and fun about pirates. Fun for all those who know everything is  better with pirates, even if pirates are grammatically incorrect.

—description from the publisher

Are you ready for high seas adventure?

Gather yer crew an’ stow yer gear, because pirates be comin’. It be time for an adventure! Pirates be ruthless. Pirates be blood-thirsty. An’ pirates also be grammatically incorrect!

In Punctuation Pirates you are a pirate sailing around the sea, gathering treasure, engaging in battle, and learning all sorts of piratical facts. But pirates have a problem and are seldom understood. It is your charge to help them along the way by correcting their grammar.

Punctuation Pirates is an educational game for 2-6 players (or groups). It is filled with many historical facts about pirates and sea-faring things. It incorporates English, history, math, geography and science with its numerous different cards. Fun for any family or any classroom.

Welcome to the world of Punctuation Pirates!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Barkham Horror: The Card Game – The Meddling of Meowlathotep: Scenario Pack
Description:
Barkham Horror is an alternate universe in which the conflict between humanity and the eldritch forces of the Mythos takes a back seat, and the conflict between dogs and cats takes center stage. In Barkham Horror: The Card Game – The Meddling of Meowlathotep, a 78-card standalone scenario pack, the investigators must stop Meowlathotep, the Prowling Chaos, Meowsenger of the Outer Feline Gods, who is terrorizing the city of Barkham. Only a few precious pups can defeat the various Meowsks of Meowlathotep and prevent them from destroying Barkham and the world!

When this adventure kicks off, you are hot on the trail of a cat conspiracy. A catspiracy, if you will. Dogs all across town report seeing strange, unnatural cats prowling the streets of Barkham, and each day more and more pigeons are going missing. You've picked up the scent of something big, and once you sink your teeth into a story, you just can't let go. A little wet fur has never stopped you from finding the truth. Perhaps if you investigate the areas of Arkham most plagued by these sightings, you can root out the catâ€monsters that dwell within.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Pluto Strikes Back!
Description:
In 1953 a group of teenagers in a small town in Kansas stopped an alien invasion from Pluto. Now the aliens want to try again, but this time they are plotting to abduct the teenagers so the next invasion can proceed unhindered by those pesky kids!

Players take the role of the aliens in this cooperative game, following in the events of the first game Pluto Attacks. This time the aliens need to resolve a number of town folk and locations to gain the skills they need to abduct the teenagers.

This is a stand alone game set in the same game world as Pluto Attacks.

Name: Whoa Nellie College Football Game
Description:
Whoa Nellie College Football Game is a new opportunity to recreate a realistic college football game!  Based on real statistics, you can pit teams from the past 50 years against each other in both solo and 2-player game play.

Take control of a team and run the ball with the top 4 rushers or throw the ball to the top 6 pass-catchers.  Their yards per carry/reception are used, as are their contribution to the offense.  Call any of 7 different defenses to stop your opponent.  Interceptions, sacks, and strategic use of the "Whoa Nellie" big play card to come out on top!

Whoa Nellie College Football provides appealing team cards, dice, and the components needed to enjoy exploring a recent team vs one from yesteryear or even pit co-national champions against each other to reveal who was truly better!

—description from the designer

Name: Double Ditto: Expansion Pack
Description: Features 300 brand new cards and a new scoresheet.

Name: Pickpockets: Business Cards
Description:
A 3-card set of bonus abilities for Pickpockets.

Description from the publisher:

The bonus cards are 3 special ability cards featuring business cards of The Cleaner, Kingpin and The Pigeon.


To play with these new bills you will swap out the bill behind the business card. The card count will be exactly as before, but with the alternate bill in place. We suggest that you shuffle the alternate bill and the one being swapped out so you don't 100% know if the alternate bills are in place.

The Cleaner counts as a regular $10 bill, but also has the bonus ability of canceling a marked bill.

The Kingpin stops a Snitch from saying they are a cop. You take an unmarked bill of your choice from their end THEN the game ends. The player with the most money wins.

The Pigeon is an ally to the Snitch / Cop in 4 player games. The player who holds the Pigeon card cannot snitch, but only wins if the cop wins. On the downside, it’s a little harder for the cop to win since the Pigeon’s marked bills don’t count.

Name: A Luminous Flame in The Darkness
Description:
A Luminous Flame in The Darkness (LFID) is innovative Board Game for sharing and learning. The LFID is Homemade Integrated Design. It is also suitable for a solo game at home.  The player can share and learn about ethic, goodness, moral, and core cultures while they adventure and explore with many experiences on the map of a community. Some happenings tend to be worse. How do they live? How do they make a decision? or How do they take an action?

Each Player can create Core Culture and a story together, including modify rules. In the game, the player may see a picture emerge of inter-relationships with multiple factors that are connected, such as causes that lead to multiple degenerations or the existence of individual forces against outer contexts. Preservation and recovery of life is more difficult than destruction. Creativity, life, people and the maintenance are essential for the existence of a core culture. The environment is not for the individual to exploit, but for all lives to enjoy.  This game simulates incidents happening in a world of fantasy in which virtue and ethics are crucial to the survival of humanity.  Each player will be able to perceive an overall concept of the core culture which they created together in the game.

    Note : In case of using for eduacional game, an experienced adult or parent is required to teach and guide.


BACKGROUND :
I graduated in Ph.D. of Arts and Culture Research from the Faculty of Fine Arts of Srinakarinwirot University in Bangkok, Thailand. My research of Green Culture for Ethics Through Documentary Films, found out the issues of many problems and wide ranging effects, including the realisation that the relationship between natures and ethics are complementary in both the individual and public contexts. The complimentary nature of living in accordance with an ecological system leads to a balance between the physical and subjective, the concrete and the abstract, human behaviour and the mind which can be seen as the foundation of ethics for peaceful and sustainable mutual living.

A Game Story :
After humanity has destroyed nature and the environment in many areas, some of the areas have  been restored and rejuvenated. Nevertheless, many people turn to violence to hurt and destroy each other for fame and wealth, focusing on dominating the land which causes many problems and adverse living conditions.  People have lost trust for each other : no faithfulness exists. They have lived in unsafe place and lead insecure lives. At the same time that pollution has dominated and deterioration also spreads widely into several areas.  In one remote district, a city that was once full of happiness, many things have began to change. However, the last thing that still keeps faith and hope and that will not be destroyed so easily, the GOODNESS OF PEOPLE

OBJECTIVE
All players help most members in their community to stay away from evil power before most terrible things appear. They try to cultivate goodness and ethics in the land of loss before the darkness comes.  At the end of game, all players consider successful future and present outcomes together.

GENRE
Fantasy game, 
Solo Game,
Co-operative game, 
Strategic game, 
and Educational game

COMPONENTS
1. 16 Miniatures / 16 Character Markers
2. 3 Draw Bags
3. 12 Intelligence Dice
4. 12 Conscience Dice
5. 6 Open-Mind Dice
6. 8 Sincerity Dice
7. 12 Tolerance/Endurance Dice
8. 12 Evil Dominance Dice
9. 2 Protection Dice
10. 20 Moral Cards (5 Principles)
11. 47 Happening Cards
12. 4 Ending Cards
13. 6 Random Quality Cards
14. 76 Encounter Cards
15. 6 Item Cards
16. 15 Special Person Cards
17. 11 Monster Cards
18. 1 Devil Card
19. 5 Mechanical Move Cards
20. 59 Person Tokens
21. 89 Merit Tokens
22. 224. Virtue Tokens / Strength Tokens
23. 156 Evil Tokens
24. 36 Dice Modification Tokens
25. 20 Time Interval Markers
26. 20 Friendship Markers
27. 40 Round Sequence Markers
28. 12 Obstacle Markers
29. 8 Fire Markers
30. 82 State Markers
31. 30 Relationship Markers
32. 28 Internal Drive Markers
33. 4 Storage Marker
34. 7 Monster Markers
35. 59 Person Indicators
36. 24 Place Indicators
37. 4 Mind Quality Boards
38. 4 Characteristic Board
39. 1 Investigation Board
40. 1 Game Board
41. 1 Rule Book

WARNING : This is not a toy. Not for use by children under age of 4 years old.  The game contains small parts that can be swallowed.

—description from the designer

Name: Drink Drank Drunk: The Game of Mis-Beer-Having
Description:
A party game, essentially about getting drunk, but including three variants that include ways to lose.

In all versions of the game, you draw a card and do as instructed. Some cards have actions that happen immediately, others are rules, powers or weaknesses, and then there are the special and wild cards.

In the "Wild Kings" variant, the wild cards must be included and whoever draws the final wild card loses.

In the "Drinking Buddies" variant, each team has an amount of drinks available, and the team that first finishes their drink stock, loses.

In the "Dranky's Hat" variant, a glass or bottle of drink is placed in the middle of the table. Each discarded card has to be balanced on top of the glass or bottle. Whoever knocks the tower of cards over, loses the game.

—user summary

Name: The Great Wall: Black Powder
Description:
Towers & War Machines
Employ crafty engineers to build ingenious, death-bringing machines, and to raise towers with slots for them!

Each player will be able to build towers (they are located between Wall Sections) and place chosen war machines onto them. There are three variants of War Machines: cannons, rocket batteries, and powerful siege crossbows.

Not only you will be able to use them in the game, greatly enhancing your defense potential, but also, each player will get a few upgrade cards to choose from, giving further variation and replay possibilities to the War Machines. For example, one player might favor building cannons, but they want them to be as cheap as possible, while another might concentrate on a single but very powerful one.

Additional Horde types & Siege Engines
Mongols have brought some siege engines with them! Some of the Hordes cards will come with the special engines to try and break your walls. Defend yourself against battering rams, which will break your walls, catapults, which will strike your archers, and Hordes with siege towers, which will change the way you plan your defense. They will try and counteract your towers, employing miners to tear them down.

New Hordes will add to the replayability while being able to be used in basic games as well.

New Troops!
Each Clan sends out their elite warriors to join the fray - all of the Clans will have their own unique and extremely powerful Soldier! You can upgrade one of your basic Soldier types into an elite. For example, Snake Clan will be upgrading their Archers into Chu-Ko-Nu Crossbowmen, being able to outshoot any of the opponents quickly. On the other hand, Dragon Clan, as befits their name, will equip some of their Spearmen with fire-lances. You can be sure they won’t be cheap, but if you can get them recruited early in the game, you will gain a huge advantage over the Hordes (and your opponents).

New Generals, Advisor, Artefacts and Tech-Trees!
This expansion brings also new Generals, Advisors and Artifacts to further enhance replayability and allow for bigger customization of your desired tactics.

Additionally, this expansion will introduce Tech-Trees creating new exciting possibilities of development for each clan. Whit those cards you will be able to adjust your strategy and invest into Towers, War Machines or enhanced Army units!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Great Wall: Iron Dragon
Description:
This special addon consists of 1 big miniature, 1 mini board and deck of 5 cards.

The Dragon is the weapon of last resort, to use if you see that you won’t be able to hold a Wall. Using it carries great danger, but usually positive effects will overshadow the negatives.

If you want to use Iron Dragon you will have to assign Clerk to it. First player will have to spend resources to cast the cannon, but will get to choose on which Wall Section it will be deployed. It is obvious, that Emperor will bestow great Honor on the one, who created such a great weapon. Then, all players can send their Clerk to shoot from the Iron Dragon. When player shoots, they draw 1 card from mini-deck, showing what effect the shot had. Effects vary from blowing huge hole in the Horde card, through just scaring them off for a turn, to cannon exploding and destroying current level of the wall.

If you do not like the random effect you can play that you can choose the effect - even exploding it sometimes, so other player cannot use it or you can build it (and earn Honor for doing so) yourself.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tres de troula
Description:
Included in the book EBA 5.0, which commemorates the 50th anniversary of the publication of A Esmorga, by Eduardo Blanco Amor. Tres de troula is a board game that takes you through the world of this story.

Each player will become a character from A Esmorga, with its different characteristics, which will give them bonus on dice rolls. They will have to find a balance between drunkenness and thought.

The board is discovered as you move through it, turning around the square you fall into. The condition of victory is to get home first, after a night of partying.

—user summary

Name: こなもんっ！(Konamon!)
Description:
Konamon! (literally "things made from flour") is a game about sharing a kitchen but competing to get the most points. You'll have to work together with the other staff if you ever want to serve a customer, but if you cooperate you can end up giving the other players points.

Each round a new customer arrives at the restaurant. Then each player chooses an action card and reveals them simultaneously. Actions are taken from the lowest number up; you can prep food in the kitchen, move food from the kitchen to the burners, or serve cooked food to customers. Each action succeeds only if there's space for the food. You get one point for each action you complete, plus bonus points if you fill up a customer's order. This repeats until all the customers are gone.

There's one big wrinkle in the dough though - each round customers get more impatient, and if they get fed up and leave the player currently in first loses points. This means that if you're behind it's in your best interest to antagonize the leader by filling the kitchen with food nobody ordered, serving customers who just arrived first, or other kinds of bad service. But since you might be the leader next turn you'll have to strike a balance.

What will you cook up in Konamon!?

—user summary

Name: The Presidential Wall Game
Description:
Now everyone can build a GREAT, GREAT wall…or knock it down!  It’s a HUGE hit, no matter which side you’re on!
Remove bricks without knocking the President off the wall. If he falls, you’re fired! Helps develop fine motor skills – which leads to lower unemployment rates. Includes handsome, really rich character (President Trump likeness) which balances on the wall. You will have many, many fun times playing this game. The best times.

—description from the publisher

Name: Paladins of the West Kingdom: Meeple Folk
Description:
4 additional townsfolk cards released as part of the Season 3 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

Jeremy - Labourers may always be used as Merchants
David - Labourers may always be used as Fighters
Kira - Labourers may always be used as Scouts
Ryan - Labourers may always be used as Clerics

—description from the designer
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Iron Helm: Adventure Pack #3 – Galnok's Labyrinth
Description:
Galnok's Labyrinth is the 3rd Adventure Pack for Iron Helm that adds all new Loot, Skills, Trappings, Plots, a new Boss to fight, and a new Character to play as. You will need to own the base game of Iron Helm to play this expansion.

Galnok's Labyrinth is a level two Adventure Pack meaning it is to be incorporated with the base game as your second adventure if you survive the base game.

1 Boss Card - 1 Character Card - 1 Skill Card - 3 Trappings Cards - 3 Loot Cards - 3 Plot Cards - 5 Enemy Cards - 1 Map Card

--description from designer

Name: Sovereign Skies: Houses Rising
Description: A set of 4 cards giving variable player powers to each unique house in Sovereign Skies.

Name: Sovereign Skies: Tides of Triumph
Description: This expansion adds additional bonus abilities for players during the game. During setup, shuffle the deck of Tides of Triumph cards and place them to the right of the first player. Flip one card face up, and place the Tides of Triumph Time-token onto the top-most hex space. On your turn you may follow the instructions on the card. If you're the first player, move the time token one space down before starting your turn. If the time-token can't be moved down because it's on the bottom-most space, discard the event card, then flip a new card from the deck. Place the time-token on the top-most space of that card.

Name: Sovereign Skies: Cosmic Calamity
Description: Cosmic Calamity gives players opportunities to engage with the citizens of the Abyssi Cluster. At the start of the game, all players start with five standard influence. Shuffle the deck of Cosmic Calamity cards, and place it to the right of the first player. Flip one card face up and place the cosmic calamity time token on the top-most hex space. There are three different types of track cards which represent certain types of events and give certain types of actions. During your turn, you may follow the instructions on the card. If you do so, you place a ship from your supply on the card. Each player may only contribute to the Cosmic Calamity card once per turn.

Name: Out Style
Description:
The third in a trilogy series of sports titles by Medieval Lords, this is a crazy fast game of streetball. It is basically basketball but focused heavily on pure showmanship and individual skill display.

In Out Style, you win the game by scoring 2 Baskets. Alas, this is Streetball, not basketball. On the street, style is just as important as scoring, if not more. You can actually win without getting a Basket in, simply by achieving 42 Style points first - after which you would have won the heart of the audience which then proceeds to jeer your opponents off the court and you win in style.

Players will take turns taking on the Offensive and Defensive roles. The Offense player plays one card at a time, getting closer to the net with each successful play. The Defense player decides if he wishes to play a Defense card to steal the ball, and if so, which one from his hand. Even if Defense fails to snatch the ball, there is accumulating defensive pressure building up each time as the Offense player goes deeper into the arc until eventually the Offense gets overwhelmed by Defence. This is where the Offense can decide to pass the ball, which resets all cumulative defensive pressure back to zero. Then again, passing should not be something you do often since it gives the Defensive player Style points for pressuring you into passing!

When you get close enough, you play a Shoot card and hope your opponent does not block it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nice Egg!
Description: Nice Egg! (ãƒŠã‚¤ã‚¹ã‚¨ãƒƒã‚°ï¼) is a yolk-dropping action game in which players are challenged to drop yolks one by one each round. Can you be a fried egg master?

Name: Kappa Bros!
Description:
Depending on the roll of the fish dice, each turn in Kappa Bros! (ã‚«ãƒƒãƒ‘å…„å¼Ÿ), you either add more water to the plate, move the plate to another Kappa, or do both! Whoever breaks the surface tension and spills any water loses.

Kappa Bros! is an authorized reworking of KAPPA-TAN, first released by Itsuka Tanaka and ASOBI.dept.

Name: S. A. Andree's North Pole Expedition
Description:
An antique board game, presumably published between Andrée's first attempt in 1896 and his historic failure in 1897, with the trademark for Luxus Papier Fabrik, Berlin, and a copyright mark, Made in Germany.

A double folding board, approx 23" [58.5cm] square when opened, with a portrait vignette of Andrée, Surcouf, Godard and Strindberg in each corner, each following a route to the pole along numbered places. According to the Instruction sheet, the game should contain :- Plan, 4 balloons, 2 dice, and a number of counters. Box cover is with a portrait vignette of Andrée and an unfortunately chosen picture of three men in a balloon amongst an iceberg laden sea, the drag lines lying in the water.

—user summary

Name: Cryptic
Description:
Cryptic is a party game whereby you create a rule to guide other people in the game through a series of cards with quotes and images on them. Players simultaneously receive a rule and path of cards, give a rule and path of cards, as well as try to deduce the rules on other's paths.

A word of warning, one must take caution with your choice of rule. It must be obvious enough to guide someone correctly through the path of cards, but cryptic enough to not be easily guessed by onlookers...

—description from the designer

Name: Synchronized
Description:
Two teams come face to face to perform the best routine in this synchronized swimming card game!

Memorize your routine, and recreate it all with cards. The team with the highest score after four rounds wins the game.

Every round is in three faces: Rehearsal, Competition, Performance. 
In Rehearsal both teams will lay out a routine with 6 to 11 pose cards and memorize the sequence. Once a team has their routine memorized, they grab the whistle to end this phase for both teams, and cards are flipped face down. 
For the Competition, a duplicate deck is dealt among team members. Players place cards face down below their corresponding rehearsal cards. 
Once both teams are done, each team will Perform, flipping and comparing all their cards. For each matching rehearsal and competition card pose, they score a point. 
Each round increases with one additional routine pose, and a Challenge card adding rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Letra+Letra
Description:
It is a game for children from 6 years that encourages literacy and fun with family and friends.
The deck consists of 140 cards, with letters and drawings, all in capital letters. You can play 2 to 5 players, and each of the games last between 5 and 10 minutes.

With the same deck of cards, you can play two different modes:

-I want it: Each player receives 4 drawings and as the letters appear on the table, each judar says if he "wants it". The goal is to form 2 of the 4 words that touched him. The first to do so wins. But be careful, some rules can complicate the game.

-Forming drawings: each participant receives 10 letters, and as drawings appear, participants must form the words. The first who forms 4 wins.


Es un juego para chicos a partir de 6 años que fomenta la lectoescritura y la diversión en familia y con amigos.
El mazo consta de 140 cartas, con letras y dibujos, todo en imprenta mayúscula. Se puede jugar de 2 a 5 jugadores, y cada uno de los juegos duran entre 5 y 10 minutos.

Con el mismo mazo de naipes, podés jugar a dos modalidades diferentes:

-La Quiero: Cada jugador recibe 4 dibujos y a medida que aparecen las letras en la mesa, cada judar dice si "la quiere". El objetivo es formar 2 de las 4 palabras que le tocó. El primero que lo hace, gana. Pero cuidado, algunas reglas pueden complicarte el juego.

-Formando dibujos: cada participante recibe 10 cartas, y a medida que aparecen dibujos, los participantes deben formar las palabras. El primero que forma 4, gana.

Name: GUAU!
Description:
GUAU! is a fun game for boys from 3-4 years.

In turn, each participant must place a token, and whoever comes first to the spoon will win. Do not forget to shout GUAU!

The game has 80 chips with different categories that will allow players to move forward, backward or find obstacles on their way to the spoon. Whoever comes first will win.


GUAU! es un divertido juego para chicos a partir de los 3-4 años.

Por turnos, cada participante deberá colocar una ficha, y quien llegue primero a la cucha, ganará. No te olvides de gritar GUAU!

El juego tiene 80 fichas con distintas categorias que les permitirá a los jugadores avanzar, retroceder o encontrar obstáculos en su camino hacia la cucha. Quien llegue primero, ganará.

Name: MemoLetras
Description:
Memoletras is an evolved memotest.
With 40 letters arranged on the table in a hidden way, each participant must turn 4 in their turn. Each participant receives 2 tokens, each with a 4-letter word.
If he manages to turn the 4 that make up one of the words he touched, he shows it and forms the first word. If it does not form a word, it must remember the letters that appear in its turn and in that of its opponents.

With italic words, you must test your memory.
From 7 years old, between 2 and 5 players.


Memoletras es un memotest evolucionado. 
Con 40 letras dispuestas en la mesa de forma ocultas, cada participante deberá dar vuelta 4 en su turno. Cada participante recibe 2 fichas, cada una con una palabra de 4 letras.
Si logra dar vuelta las 4 que conforman alguna de las palabras que le tocó, la muestra y forma la primera palabra. Sino forma una palabra, deberá recordar las letras que aparezcan en su turno y en el de sus oponentes.

Con palabras en cursiva, deberás poner a prueba tu memoria.
A partir de los 7 años, entre 2 y 5 jugadores.

Name: The Fight for Seoul
Description:
Andy Hershey, prolific creator who brought you Kreta, Kampgruppe Scherer; The Shield of Cholm, & St. Nazaire, to name but a few, has  designed this giant Korean module.  This is the largest module ever produced by LFT.  4 Historical maps (2 for each CG), 2 campaign games, 21 scenarios, counters, rules, play aides, charts, etc.

This boxed set contains two "CG modules" and associated charts and rules for each CG.  Also contains a sheet of counters (5/8" and 1/2").

Smith’s Ridge module:

2 A1 maps (23 x 33 inches) for a total playing area of 33 x 46 inches.
    Specific rules booklet (28 pages)
    11 scenarios
    3 pages of Terrain charts

Seoul module:

2 A1 maps (23 x 33 inches) for a total playing area of 33 x 46 inches.
    Specific rules booklet (36 pages)
    10 scenarios
    4 pages of Terrain charts

This is not a complete product.  Ownership of the ASL system, including Forgotten War is required.

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Thor Hero Pack
Description:
Join the fight for freedom with the Thor Hero Pack for Marvel Champions: The Card Game!

With the mythical hammer Mjolnir, Thor has the power to defeat even the strongest of foes with legendary strength and power.

Like all Hero Packs, the Thor Hero Pack includes a fully-playable deck right out of the box that includes 15 Hero cards, 17 cards from the Aggression aspect, and 8 neutral cards.  This deck allows you to harness the power of Thor, who is rewarded for engaging and dispatching villainous minions from the field!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Hit the Moon
Description:
The game is a variation of the Tailless Donkey where players take turns in trying to stick a rocket on the moon.

Players select a rocket which has a sticky adhesive on the tip and places a cardboard space mask on. After a couple turns the players tries to stick the rocket on a thick paper chart with a large central moon.

If successful they win a prize

The chart has other planets such as Mercury, Venus, Mars, Saturn, Jupiter and Pluto and sticking your rocket on these requires the player to act out or make a strange sound.

—user summary

Name: Jackal Archipelago: The card game
Description:
Yarrr! We’re out of gold! It’s time to and some more! Take your cards – they will lead you to the treasure islands. And they can help you and a way among all treacherous traps that are lying there. Truth be told, there are other pirates who seek the gold just as you do… So you better make it quick, or else you’ll have to share!

How to play
You land on the island with traps and chests full of gold. Use the arrow cards to build the shortest possible route from the Landing tile to the chest. Or else you’ll have to share your gold with other pirates! You can blue and land in secret areas, half-way to the chest. Or you can stay on the ship to save your breath and cards for the next island. A seasoned captain always thinks ahead. Whoever be the richest after visiting 6 islands, will be the winner.

Perfect for:

     Young and energetic adventure seekers.
     Playing with the whole family. Young seamen will develop their logic and spatial thinking to become fully ledged captains.
     Giving as a present to the fans of other Jackal games.
     Playing on the road, below the sails and in the open air. Take a handy bag with you wherever you want.


—description from the publisher

Name: Transformers Trading Card Game: War for Cybertron – Siege II
Description:
Each booster box of Transformers Trading Card Game: War for Cybertron – Siege II, which constitutes wave 4 of releases for the Transformers TCG, contains thirty booster packs as well as a TRYPTICON pack that holds one Titan-sized TRYPTICON character card and three large character cards as his minions: BRUNT, FULL-TILT and WIPE-OUT.

—description from the publisher
